## Overview

Springer Nature Experiments is a comprehensive database of peer-reviewed laboratory protocols from leading journals including Nature Protocols, Nature Methods, and other Springer Nature publications. It provides access to detailed, tested methods across all areas of the life sciences.

## Key Features

- **Peer-Reviewed Protocols**: High-quality, validated experimental methods
- **Detailed Procedures**: Step-by-step instructions with timing and troubleshooting tips
- **Video Protocols**: Visual demonstrations of complex techniques
- **Protocol Search**: Find methods by technique, organism, or application
- **Materials Lists**: Comprehensive lists of required reagents and equipment
- **Linked Publications**: Connect protocols to original research papers
- **Expert Authors**: Methods from leading researchers in each field

## Use Cases in Research

- Finding established protocols for standard techniques
- Learning new experimental methods with expert guidance
- Accessing video demonstrations of complex procedures
- Troubleshooting experimental issues with detailed tips
- Citing standardized methods in publications
- Teaching laboratory techniques to students and staff

## Getting Started

Visit [experiments.springernature.com](https://experiments.springernature.com) to search protocols and access content through your institutional subscription.
